lexUnit.name: sluggish.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: indisposed to action or exertion; unenergetic

sentence.text: Anyway , at the luncheon concerned he adopted precisely this cautious attitude and the conversation was as sluggish as it is possible to imagine .
It may seem odd to fret about this while economies are still sluggish , but in past recoveries governments have often kept their foot on the accelerator too long .
Charlotte knew she should glean as much as she possibly could , but her brain seemed sluggish and uninventive .
Even reporters are sluggish on Sundays .
The recovery from the war was sluggish and financially hairy .
To start with , Wright was sluggish in covering the court .
Fish , which in the cold European waters are sluggish and easily caught , often provide the staple for mink over the winter .
Flow on this stretch is usually sluggish but today , with the extra water , the flow is much quicker but I should still be able to use a waggler .
The ferry turned into the sluggish waters of the Channel .
It can be a gentle paddle on sluggish water or a 25 yd shoot down a narrow rocky gut under the trees .
D'Arcy 's aircraft had nosed cautiously down through the dense , sluggish cloudcover which had kept the lid firmly on the sultry atmosphere of the city for the past week .
Some are rapid swimmers gathered together in silvery shoals , others sluggish bottom dwellers spending most of their time buried in sediment .
The air was green water , and the trees were some great submarine growths slowly swaying in the sluggish currents .
Up to one million purchases are estimated to have been delayed during the last three years because of the sluggish market .
The south-facing windows had a view of the sluggish grey river .
The attack had the effect of stalling the already sluggish Middle East peace process .
The kind of symptoms ; sluggish cars and poor performance .
Shares rose sharply at the beginning of the year in anticipation of an economic rebound , but the recovery has so far been very sluggish .
As such , they are less sluggish than the average band .
If anything , the metabolism of the obese becomes more sluggish when exposed to the cold .
He was oddly sluggish and lazy , more like a leery veteran than a horse that had never seen a racecourse .
The larvae are unique in that hey are present in fresh faeces , are characteristically sluggish , and their intestinal cells are filled with dark brown food granules ( Fig. 21 ) .

The several carnivores , such as the badger and the skunk , which are noticeably sluggish for their size , are species which either do not need speed for capturing prey or have alternative means of self-defence .
Company car drivers used to beg off being given a diesel by protesting that it was just too sluggish for business use .
